sevp_portal.title: SEVP Portal Overview and Set Up

questions.question: What should I know about the SEVP portal?
questions.answer: All students on Post-Completion OPT are required to report their personal information and employment information on the SEVP Portal within 10 days of the change.

additional_info.system_integration: The SEVP portal is connected to SEVIS (Student and Exchange Visitor Information System) and data is shared between the two systems

questions.question: How will I get access to the SEVP portal?
questions.answer: Students approved for OPT will be contacted on their OPT start date to create their SEVP portal account.

troubleshooting.if_not_received: Check spam or junk mail folder

questions.question: How can I set up my SEVP portal account?
questions.answer: Create your account using the temporary password and unique registration link and begin reporting your information.

setup_restrictions.link_usage: Can only use the link once
setup_restrictions.validity: Link valid for 14 days from sending
setup_restrictions.if_expired: Contact isss@usfca.edu to have the notice sent again

pre_completion_note.access: Students approved for Pre-Completion OPT do not get access to the SEVP portal
pre_completion_note.address_changes: Should report changes to their address on MyISSS

questions.question: What are the reporting requirements on OPT?
questions.answer: Students are required to report changes to your address and employment information to the SEVP portal within 10 days of the change while on Post-Completion OPT.

questions.question: Why is it important to report employment on OPT?
questions.answer: You need to self-report your employment on the SEVP portal or you will be considered unemployed on OPT.
questions.unemployment_impact: Every day that a student has reported qualifying employment on the SEVP portal will not count towards the 90-day unemployment limit

questions.question: What information is needed to report?
questions.answer: When reporting your employment on the SEVP portal, you will need to list your work address and document how your employment is related to your major field of study.

work_location.remote: Remote address as work location if working remotely

employment_details: Number of hours you are working per week
How your job duties relate to your major field of study

bachelors_business.example: I work full time as a Loan Officer at a mortgage company, Happy Homes, where I meet with clients and evaluate, authorize and recommend approval of loan applications. On a daily basis, I use the knowledge I gained in my credit analysis, sales and marketing classes that I took as part of my major program of study.

masters_kinesiology.example: I am working 25 hours a week in a health food store as a consultant for Self-Made Inc., designing and teaching exercise classes that are incorporated into a customer's overall nutrition and exercise plan. My designs and customer instruction draw upon my studies and classwork in exercise therapy and physical reconditioning.

documentation.record_keeping: Keep records of all OPT employment for future evidence if needed

stem_opt_note.difference: OPT reporting requirements differ to STEM OPT reporting requirements
stem_opt_note.stem_reporting: Need to report job changes to MyISSS

status_changes.title: Reporting Change in Status to ISSS while on OPT

questions.question: If you change your visa status while on OPT, what should you do next?
questions.answer: If you have been approved and have changed to another immigration status during your OPT period, report this Change of Status to ISSS.

reporting_process.method: Submit a Visa Category Update request via MyISSS
reporting_process.purpose: To check that your F-1 record is ended correctly

important_notes.status_maintenance: In most cases, you won't be able to maintain your OPT and F-1 status when you are in another status in the U.S.
important_notes.consultation: Speak with your immigration attorney and ISSS if changing immigration status

questions.question: What is the Cap Gap Extension?
questions.answer: Students who have a pending or approved cap-subject H-1B petition and requested a Change of Status to H-1B before their F-1 status ends are eligible for a Cap Gap extension.

extension_details.purpose: Extend F-1 status and, in some cases, work authorization before H-1B goes into effect
extension_details.request_process: Can request a Cap Gap I-20 via MyISSS
